text: Clear golden with white haed. Aroma is big fruity hops, but really light and crisp. Very good stuff!

Pours a golden straw from a can, slight honey aroma along with some grass. A hint of lemon in the mouth, but mostly a nice grassiness. Very well balanced. Pretty good beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft in a chalice glass. Appears pale gold with a dingy white head. Aroma is pretty good, although Id describe it as being a mixture of straw, lemon zest, and mildew. This beer finds a good balance between old and new world, where there is base of grainy/pale/cereal malt flavor intertwining with lemon rind. Its light, yet flavorful. A decent ber that veers from tradition moderately.
Can. Classic pils crispness and grain profile with a bit of grapefruit and lemon peel. Pleasant.

12 ounce can poured into a brandy snifter. The beer is a clear gold with a big head of white foam. The aroma is grassy and herbal with notes of fresh baked bread. Taste is dry and herbal up front, but gets a touch sweet. A bit of lemon peel shows through. I get a nice biscuit character in the finish. Lighter to medium body and moderate carbonation. Awesome beer!

3 month old can > pils glass.
A: Clear medium yellow with a short white head. Decent retention and lace. A few bubbles.
S: Hay, grass and lightly toasted bread. Herbal hops
T: Hard lemon smack lingering and joined by crisp biscuit/cracker. Bitter, bready and tart. Little pith despite the lemon dominance. Taste does not resemble the nose.
M: Medium body. Slightly resinous lingering bitter finish. Fine carbonation.
O: Very nice. Elegant and even distinctive with its lemony flavor. I wish I could buy this at home.
Tap. Pours clear golden, small white head, good lacing. Aroma is cracker, grass, grains. Flavor is very light sweet, light clean bitterness. Light body. Sharp and clean. Nice.
Poured at Bauhaus nice foamy head with lacing, lemongrass at the front with hops following with a slightly bitter aftertaste
large white fluffy head that dissipates only very slowly. the aroma is spectacular on this beer - passionfruit, mango, lemongrass. Nice balance, rich ready malt flavor. finishes crisp and clean.

Hoppy and refreshing. Very pilsner like with that antifreeze edge to it. Good beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pretty good stuff. More bitter than the Czech Pils that Ive had in Eastern Europe, but still quite tasty. Large foamy head settle slowly. Nice spicy aroma with a bit o hops. Good body and finish.

Tap - small foamy head, medium gold color, balanced aroma and flavor, with some herbal notes coming from somewhere (hops?), mild cereal malt backbone, crisp finish, good overall 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can: Grassy hay nose. Hazy amber, medium head, nice retention and lacing. Fairly intense hay and lemongrass. Minty grass noble hop finish. Medium body, moderate carbonation. Thats a lot of flavor for one pilsner. Drinks like an imperial pils. Damn good rendition of the style.

Can at home. Pours hazy gold with a large, frothy white head, medium retention with good lacing. Aroma is lightly sweet grainy Pils malt, earthy and medium hops. Flavor is clean and lightly sweet grainy Pils malt, light spicy hops and medium bitterness with a dry finish. Light body and moderate carbonation.
Average looking pour. Floral and citrus nose, some good hops there. Not bad for a pilsner.

Typical pilsner look. Clear golden body with a average white head. Aromas of biscuit, honey, cereal grains, grape jam, and floral hops. Very nice effervescent flavor. Hop bitterness is balanced well with some sweetness from the malt. Very nice pilsner and one Ill be buying more regularly in the future.

Can from bradley...thx man...not my usual style but the tweak of raised hops interested me...nose was pleasant and not as much grain scent which i really like...hops was present in mouth also...again a plus...nice brew i would drink again...nice clean and refreshing.

12 fl oz can via Piscator34. Pours a light and very mildly hazy straw colour with a large white meringue-like head. Aromas are grain and mildly sweet citrus/floral. Tastes are grainy but with some malt and hop presence. Light body, assertive carbonation, medium hoppy finish. A little more character than a typical pilsner.

Poured from the can from tavour. Thick head, light hazy straw color. Aroma is pretty much what a pilsner smell like. Grainy. Flavor is similar, grainy, but clean. Some hop bitterness is detected on the back end. Getting better as it goes, quite refreshing also. As pilsner goes, this is as good as it gets.

Can. Pours a clear yellow gold body under a small thin and fizzy white head. The nose is nice floral and noble hops with a very clean and soft bready malt base. The flavor is quite light and delicate with a well attenuated bready pils malt base. Some lingering noble hop flavor with moderate bitterness. Light bodied and easy drinking with fine fizzy carbonation. Decent stuff, not among my favorites for the style, but its enjoyable.
Tap at Pizza Luce. Pale yellow with a sticky white head and fine bubbles. Wet grass, malty and white bread. Medium sweet with a grassy aftertaste. Medium body with a fizzy feel.

Clear gold pour with a fluffy white head tons of lacing. Aroma is floral, spicy hops, lemon zest, and crackers. Taste is floral, honey, biscuits, grass, and lemon peel. Nice bitterness. Clean and crisp.

12 oz. can from arminjewell- thanks again, Armin! Pours a barely cloudy bright pale gold with a finger of fizzy white head that laces the glass and settles unevenly. Pale and pils and crackery malts lead the way, with starw, grass, florals, and lemon zest. Light-bodied, with moderate to medium carbonation and a clean, malty mouthfeel. Very nice pils.

On tap in Minneapolis (MN)

Hard to pin down, this release mixes a little Old World with new in a blend that sparkles. Whatever is going on here defies categorization. If more breweries attempt anything similar I would certainly love to try them for comparisons sake.

Aroma / Appearance - Golden carbonated body bubbles with a crisp white head the color of bleached towels. Lemons, starchy yeast, and bright open hops float upwards with a focus on the citrusy feel of spring.

Flavor / Palate - A fresh feeling pilsener sparkles and immediately provides refreshment. An easy drinking body flows freely from start to finish. The dry finish then kicks it up a notch making me wish I had more than just a four once pour. With so many options in the local market it still manages to carve out a niche that makes it memorable.

Can shared by jackl, 6/3/15. Hazy yellow, large foamy white head, good retention. Aroma of noble, grassy hops, pale malt. The taste is doughy malt, apples, noble hops. Medium bodied, well balanced, crisp, refreshing.

Draught at the very nice, modern but charming and thoughtful brewpub, followed by a can two weeks later. Clear straw. Generous malt base makes for a sweet, round... not quite sugary, but almost borderline pilsner with a snappy, juicy fruity, citrusy, tropical hop presence whose deployment is kept aback by the strong maltiness, but whose soft, aromatic forward, neither resinous nor rough profile maintain a very high drinkability. Limited bitterness in spite of the high hop presence, they seem mostly the aromatic kind which enhances drinkability, but makes the chubby malts even more proeminent. It remains a highly drinkable offering, perhaps not as innovative as it claims to be and not quite up there with the likes of Jacks Abby, but at less than $2 a can, its a really good buy.

This is a nice beer, though the branding/description is way too ambitious (there are 2000+ brewers in the U.S. now, and a good many of them are trying to brew interesting things....) Youve got here a solid pilsner on the sweeter side, and mild hopping that gives it a robustness but nothing akin to an American hop-influenced beer, of most any style. Still, fine, reasonably easy drinking. (on tap, Grand Central, St. Paul)
Sampled at Northgate Liquors MN beer tasting. Crisp, wheat, grassy. Lots of wheat.

Tap at Pizza Luce Seward location. Pint glass. Typical golden color with half finger slightly off white head. Aroma is grassy, grainy, and rather dull. Taste brings a little funk and metallic quality. Hops are most prevalent at the start. Slightly sweet with a malty finish. Clean mouthfeel. Really didnt go for anything unique or different. Just a standard pilsner.

On tap at the brewery. Pour is clear golden with a big white head and good lacing. Big grassy, minerals, somewhat chalky, biscuit, floral, herbal hoppy, and doughy aroma. Taste is mineralloc, chalky, grassy, biscuit, straw, light hay, and dough with a crisp finish. Medium body with high carbonation. Solid Pilsener.

Can. Quite hoppy nose, Nelson Sauvin I would guess. Grapefruit, herbs, a touch of cat piss. Light malt. Deep golden color, clear. Flavor is a bit creamy, with a cedar note, lemony, peppery. Very interesting take on a Svelty. Good stuff.

Tap at Bauhaus. Sweetish pale malt nose with a lot of grassiness and moderate pleasant hops. Clear bright straw color. Clean and very smooth grassy initial; the hoping enters and intensifies slightly through mid palate and final. Thin-medium. Mild and very flavorful stuff. As clean as they come; one of the better pils made in the US.
UPDATED: APR 14, 2015 This was a nice suprise. On tap at red cow. It had a nice citrus and grassy aroma and flavor up front with a nice hit of saaz spice in the middle and backend.

From can. Pours a clear straw gold hue with light, soft white head. Aroma of grassy, subtle citrus, subtle bitter spice, lemon. Flavor of lemon, earthy, grassy, tangerine, mandarin, light hop spiciness, some cracker. Finish is dry with a hint of sweetness. On the palate, lingers with some grass, herbal, straw, citrus. Overall clean taste but very complex for a pilsner. The best pilsner I've had to date!




---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap at barrio in St. Paul.
Gold pour, thin head.
Earthy, lemony and light grassy. 
Grain and grass flavour with a light citrus. Soft carb. Very nice. 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Solid pilsner here tried at the brewery during their first month. clean with a good amount of hops

(can) Pours a clear golden color with a medium white head that really settles down quickly. Interesting aroma here. Theres some lemon, pizza crust, garden veggie dip, and a vague, unidentifiable citrusy component (well it could be clementine or tangerine). It also seems to try to be grassy, but doesnt quite make it. Little spiciness to the hops as well. Flavor is well composed, with some cracker (intensifying in the finish), light sweetness, citrus juice, little pine-like hit, and a fairly intense herbal spiciness that is matched up with a dry, crackery finish. Hints of mineral water as well. Mouthfeel is light and carb is right on. Overall this is a very solid pils that Ill gladly buy again when I get an occasional craving for the style.

On tap at Hola. Pours a clear crisp gold with a white head that dissipates slowly to the edges and laces. Aroma has sweet grains and a bit of hay with a crisp grass backing. Flavor has sweet grain up front with a growing grass and hay note with just a hint of butteriness.

Crystal clear light Amber pour with a nice white head on draft at Republic. Cool herbal and citrus nose. Clean taste profile moving quickly from some nice citrus hops to biscuit to a slight earthy bitterness in the finish.

Keg @ Brauhaus. Gold with a small head. Nose is toasted white bread. Peach. A touch of citrus hoppiness. Taste of sweet crackers, honey. Animal cookies. Peppery hop finish. Lovely pils. Light body , refreshing. A litre of this on a hot day would be a good move.
Draft. Golden with small white head. Aroma of light grain and a hint of hops. Light body, medium citrus hop bitterness, crisp, and a dry finish.

12 oz. can. Pours a clear gold with a fizzy white head that settles to a thin fizzy film. Aroma is grassy noticeable hops and mild hidden fruit citrus Apple trying to show itself. Taste is grassy floral hops nice mild bitterness and faint fruit citrus again. Palate thin crisp and refreshing. Absolutely awesome pils!
Clear gold with a small head. Strong floral hop aroma. Lots of hay and grass. Moderately bitter. Quite grassy and grainy. Almost some citrus. Low to medium body.

UPDATED: FEB 9, 2015 Crystal clear unlike every other brew except the Original Pilsner Urquell.
Pilsner is very hard to brew but Bauhaus has done it.The citrus flavour only enhances the feels.This pilsner rivals Pilsner Urquell.

01-09-15 Left Surlys drainpour hipster brewery in St.Paul to go to Surdyks in Mpls to get REAL beer. 

The best Pilsner beer on the planet.A 5 star product.Do not miss it when in the Twin cities area.OFF hours openings so check the website before visiting.

On tap @ the brewery. Pours a clear golden appearance with a white head. Aroma is a little husky and grainy. Some lemon, spice, and corn as well. Light to medium body. Grassy and grainy. Fairly dry. Moderately high bitterness. Again some corn. Not that appealing to me.

Pour on tap at Beer Dabbler, clear yellow pour with white head, aroma brought notes of nice biscuity and crackery malts, dough, yeast comes through with nice floral, spicy noble hop like character, some honey comes through as well. Taste had a mix of grass, floral, and spicy hops mixing into some honey, slight vanilla with a touch of husky notes into nice crackery, doughy notes, finishing bitter, dry.

Tap at hola Arepa. Light gold with small white head. Smells grainy barnyard but fresh and nice. Typical pilsner taste but nicely crisp. Very fresh taste overall. Good balance and decent depth for the style. One of their better beers.

Its a drinkable pils. What makes it better than any other pils? I dont know I guess. What makes it better than any other here, or at other nearby taprooms? Nothing, really. Its a good pils...which means its drinkable and has some flavor, but not too much flavor.

Huge thanks to oakbluff for bringing a growler of this back from Minneapolis for me. Very pale gold in colour with moderate carbonation (might have lost a bit of it in transit). Superb grassy and herbal hop aromas are backed by some light clean pilsner malt notes. The malt comes through a bit more in the mouth, but its still super clean and the grassy, slightly citric, hops are still definitely present. Light bodied with a hay-like bitterness. Im quite excited to drink LOTS more of this the next time Im in the Twin Cities.

Sampled on draught at the Bauhaus Brew Labs taproom in Minneapolis, Minnesota. Pours a semi-clear golden pale colored brew with a decent sized off-white head that quickly dissipates and leaves behind some spotty lacing. Aroma of noble grassy hops, golden grain malt, crystal, and a touch of lager yeast. Taste is medium bodied, citrus/grassy hop bitterness with some golden grain malt, field weed and a touch of fruit. Finish is semi-dry, light, crisp with a quick bitterness bite that disappears right away.

Czech pils is one of those styles I seek out since my travel in the Czech Republic. I am by no means an expert on the style but have had enough of the real thing to recognize a good pils when i have it. And this is an outstanding American example. Lots of dry, grassy hops in the aroma, some citrus. Dry bread and dry; mildly bitter flavor and a bone dry grassy aftertaste.

On tap at brewpub pours a hazy bright yellow with a large white head. Aroma of pils malt, light yeast, with citrus and grassy hops. Taste of biscuit and cereal malt, light yeast, with grassy and citrus hops. Decent very drinkable.

Clear metallic yellow. Orange marmalade, regal noble hops and ebullient tropical hops in the nose. Underlying crackery malt, black and white peppercorns. Grass clippings, farm, silage. True pils with extra, lovely stuff.
Tasting this is like being in the field, breathing in its rustic layers of old leaves and dry herbs. So crisp, and gently dusted with citrus pith. Apricot flesh and clementine are also lightly present, totally sufficient to supply a tantalizing juiciness against the dry grass and the buttery biscuit pils malt.
High carb snapping with bitterness makes for a taut, clear texture. This is nothing short of excellent; alive and authentic in every shade of its character.

4 or 5 oz. pour as part of a three-beer flight, on tap at the brewerys taproom. Consumed on 7-23-14. Pours a hazy, pale gold/straw with nearly white head. Looks good. Strong, floral, citric smell features grapefruit, orange, and lemon scents. Dry, citric flavor that reminds me of Victory Prima Pils in that it is a good pilsner using American hops. Pleasant, dry finish and aftertaste. Light body. Crisp and lively in the palate. Refreshing. Overall this is a really good pilsner that is worth seeking out. I could just as easily have given this a 4 as a 3.8, but I am trying to be tougher in my ratings.
Tap at the taproom. Wow, fantastic. Clear light yellow pour with a white head. Clean and crisp, with plenty of citrus aroma and flavor. Great twist on the style.
